data.title: Convert and add
data.statement:
A numeral system (base) is a mathematical notation for representing numbers of a given set, using digits or other symbols in a consistent manner. There is decimal, binary, hexadecimal and many more bases.
For the notation of base more than 10, you will use letters from a to z. For example digits of base 16 are 0123456789abcdef.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radix

Operations can be used with every numeral systems. You can add 2 binary (base 2) numbers :
1011 + 111 = 10010

You can convert numbers to base 10 by decomposing each digit.
As you do in base 10 :
`
174 = 1 * (10 ^ 2) + 7 * (10 ^ 1) + 4 * (10 ^ 0)
`
you do the same in base 8 :
`
23 = 2 * (8 ^ 1) + 3 * (8 ^ 0) = 19 in base 10
`
or in base 16 :
`
c9 = 12 * (16 ^ 1) + 9 * (16 ^ 0) = 192 in base 10
`

<<Your job:>> Given a base [[B]], display the sum of the 3 numbers [[N]] in base [[B]]
data.constraints:
2 ≤ [[B]] ≤ 16
[[B]] is an integer
[[N]] is a string of length less than 5
data.stubGenerator:
read B:int
loopline 3 N:word(3)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An Integer [[B]] for base
<<Line 2 :>> 3 strings [[N]] separate with a space representing base [[B]] numbers

Your job: Given a base B, display the sum of the 3 numbers N in base B
Input
Line 1: An Integer B for base
Line 2 : 3 strings N separate with a space representing base B numbers
Output
Sum of 3 N entries in Base B
Constraints
2 ≤ B ≤ 16
B is an integer
N is a string of length less than 5
Example
Input
8
17 2 11
Output
32
